title: bug: CLI not working
body:
<!-- BEFORE YOU FILE A NEW ISSUE-->
<!--

0. Please search open issues before duplicating a new one.
1. Make sure you are using the latest version of everything including:
  - rustc
  - ALL relevant Tauri Libs
2. You must attach the results of cargo tauri info or yarn tauri info to your issue.
3. Make sure it is an issue with Tauri, and not something to do with your side of the stack.
4. Consider starting a discussion. Speaking of which, have you looked there? Maybe your question has been answered.
5. Remember to follow our community guidelines and be friendly.
6. Is this an issue or a feature request? If the latter, please use the other template.

-->

### **Describe the bug**
I wanted to create a CLI that allow multiple arguments without any flags similar to VSCode's and I tried the following configuration:

```json
"cli": {
    "description": "Open Xplorer and open the specified directory.",
    "args": [
            {
          "name": "dir",
          "index": 1,
          "multiple": true
        }
    ]
}
```
and it gives me the following error 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61906684/139410775-4b0ee018-c1bb-4a1e-a4cd-72d1e8d7c704.png) 
and I head on the [docs](https://tauri.studio/en/docs/guides/cli/#positional-arguments) and copied the example and also the similar error occurs:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61906684/139411429-a155c42e-fb44-4d4b-9271-376102b98f5f.png)

I have also tried to pass `--` but still the same error


### **To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to the [docs](https://tauri.studio/en/docs/usage/guides/cli/#positional-arguments)
2. Copy the example
3. Read the match on JavaScript (https://tauri.studio/en/docs/guides/cli/#javascript)
4. See the console, there's an error

### **Expected behavior**
CLI works fine and I could able to create a VSCode's similar CLI.

### **Screenshots**
See above.

### **Platform and Versions (required):**
<!-- Use `yarn tauri info` or `cargo tauri info` command to get this information, and paste it here: -->
```
Operating System - Windows, version 10.0.22000 X64
Webview2 - 95.0.1020.30

Node.js environment
  Node.js - 16.0.0
  @tauri-apps/cli - 1.0.0-beta.10
  @tauri-apps/api - 1.0.0-beta.8

Global packages
  npm - 7.10.0
  yarn - 1.22.11

Rust environment
  rustc - 1.56.0
  cargo - 1.56.0

App directory structure
/.git
/.github
/.husky
/.vs
/.vscode
/build
/coverage
/dist
/docs
/node_modules
/out
/packages
/patches
/scripts
/src
/src-tauri

App
  tauri.rs - 1.0.0-beta.8
  build-type - bundle
  CSP - default-src asset: blob: data: filesystem: ws: wss: http: https: tauri: 'unsafe-eval' 'unsafe-inline' 'self' img-src: 'self'
  distDir - ../out/src
  devPath - http://localhost:8080
  bundler - Webpack
```

### **Additional context**
More info: https://discord.com/channels/616186924390023171/625037620996734986/903540306304196618
